definition: no heart for tea or rice (idiom); melancholic and suffering/to have no appetite
tea/tea plant/CL:杯[bei1],壺|壶[hu2]
cooked rice/CL:碗[wan3]/meal/CL:頓|顿[dun4]/(loanword) fan/devotee
not to have/no/none/not/to lack/un-/-less
heart/mind/intention/center/core/CL:顆|颗[ke1],個|个[ge4]
no thought for tea or rice (idiom); melancholic and suffering/to have no appetite
to seem as if something is amiss (idiom)
to be restless
to be unable to sleep at night
depressed/gloomy
hundred knots of worry in one's intestines (idiom); weighed down with anxiety
discontented (idiom)
to ponder a solution/to consider (the best move, how to find a way etc)
all day long
long moan and short gasp (idiom); continually moaning and groaning in pain
to toss and turn restlessly (in the bed)
thoughts surging in one's mind (idiom)/different thoughts coming to mind
lit. to eat without tasting the food/worried or downhearted (idiom)
see 失魂落魄[shi1 hun2 luo4 po4]
to be unable to carry on even for a single day/to be in a desperate situation
abstracted/absent-minded/in a trance
